oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Army song book, 1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A booklet of war songs and national songs issued by the War Department Commission on Training Camp Activities and “compiled with the assistance of the National Committee on Army and Navy Camp Music.” Published in Washington, D.C. in 1918, this book of songs was illustrated by John Tinney McCutcheon, an American newspaper political cartoonist who was known as the “Dean of American Cartoonists.” The World War I, also known as the First World War or the Great War, was a global war centered in Europe that began on 28 July 1914 and lasted until 11 November 1918. Forms part of the Clarence L. Alford Collection, Box 5: Song Lyrics. 1 booklet.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: McCutcheon, John T. (John Tinney), 1870-1949
